TestCase.TestCaseObjective: BSO validation. To verify basic functionality regarding OrganisationBoundary: adding and updating boundaries between different organisations.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: Two nations are exchanging information between their C2IS's. Nation A will add an OrganisationBoundary, and then change the organisations associated with the boundary (currently, there are no formal associations, just by means of the LeftOrganisationName and RightOrganisationName elements). Nation A will then create a brigade sized boundary with no organisation associated to it.
TestCase.TestCaseEnvironment: Internet or Co-located. Exchange Pattern: R/R, P/S.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: Nation B has subscribed to receive information from the 'Forces' and 'Battlespace Geometry' topics of Nation A. Four or more organisations exist in this topic.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: Nation B receives information about organisational boundaries added and updated by Nation A. The boundaries are processed correctly by the C2IS of both Nations.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Nation A creates an OrganisationBoundary' in the'Battlespace Geometry' between two existing organisations in the 'Forces' topic (marked in its LeftOrganisationName and RightOrganisationName elements)
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: The boundary is created in Nation A's C2IS and the EchelonCode is correctly processed and integrated. Nation B receives the new boundary, and it is processed and integrated correctly in Nation B's C2IS.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Nation A updates the boundary so that it exists between two different organisations in the 'Forces' topic (its LeftOrganisationName and RightOrganisationName elements are updated)
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: The boundary is updated in Nation A's C2IS and is received by Nation B. The same information is shared in the C2IS's of both nations.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Nation A creates a second boundary for a brigade sized organisation to it.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: The boundary is created in Nation A's C2IS and the EchelonCode is integrated correctly; Nation B receives the new boundary and shares the same information.
